results.title: Polystyrene Nanoplastics Can Alter the Toxicological Effects of Simvastatin on Danio rerio
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Polystyrenes @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011137 @@@PS@@@ NPls alone did not exert effects whereas @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ (>=12.5 microg/L) significantly delayed the hatching, decreased the heartbeat, induced @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@edemas@@@ and mortality.

citations.NLM: Barreto A, Santos J, Amorim MJB, Maria VL. Polystyrene Nanoplastics Can Alter the Toxicological Effects of Simvastatin on Danio rerio Toxics. 2021 Feb 26;9(3):. PMID: 33652851

results.title: The Effect of Local Simvastatin on Alveolar Bone Regeneration, Pain, and Swelling After Tooth Extraction: a Systematic Review.
results.text_hl: The Effect of Local @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ on Alveolar Bone Regeneration, @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@Pain@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@Swelling@@@ After @DISEASE_Tooth_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D014076 @@@Tooth Extraction@@@: a Systematic Review.

results.title: Tomographic evaluation of the effect of simvastatin topical use on alveolar bone microarchitecture, pain and swelling after mandibular third molar extraction: a randomized controlled trial.
results.text_hl: Tomographic evaluation of the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ topical use on alveolar bone microarchitecture, @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@swelling@@@ after mandibular third molar extraction: a randomized controlled trial.

results.title: Comparative evaluation of the effect of simvastatin and xenograft (sticky bone) in the third molar socket after surgical removal of impacted mandibular third molar.
results.text_hl: Results: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patient@@@'s @DISEASE_Pain_Postoperative @DISEASE_MESH:D010149 @@@postoperative pain@@@ significantly reduced in both groups from third day to seventh day till one month with better outcome in group A (sticky bone) in comparison with group B (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@). @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@Swelling@@@ decreased postoperatively from third day till one month in both groups, with significant reduction in group A than group B at one month owing to the better soft tissue healing tendency of xenograft (sticky bone).

citations.NLM: Hashmi Z, Verma N, Girdhar P, Damini, Verma DA. Comparative evaluation of the effect of simvastatin and xenograft (sticky bone) in the third molar socket after surgical removal of impacted mandibular third molar. Natl J Maxillofac Surg. 2025 May-Aug;16(2):321-327. PMID: 41019678
citations.BibTeX: @article{41019678, title={Comparative evaluation of the effect of simvastatin and xenograft (sticky bone) in the third molar socket after surgical removal of impacted mandibular third molar.}, author={Hashmi Z and Verma N and Girdhar P and Damini and Verma DA}, journal={Natl J Maxillofac Surg}, volume={16}, number={2}, pages={321-327}}

results.title: A phase II clinical trial of the Safety Of Simvastatin (SOS) in patients with pulmonary lymphangioleiomyomatosis and with tuberous sclerosis complex.
results.text_hl: No @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ withdrew or had a reduction in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ dose because of adverse events.

citations.NLM: Krymskaya VP, Courtwright AM, Fleck V, Dorgan D, Kotloff R, McCormack FX, Kreider M. A phase II clinical trial of the Safety Of Simvastatin (SOS) in patients with pulmonary lymphangioleiomyomatosis and with tuberous sclerosis complex. Respir Med. 2020 Mar;163():105898. PMID: 32125970

results.title: Embryotoxicity of Statins and other Prescribed Drugs with Reported Off-target Effects on Cholesterol Biosynthesis.
results.text_hl: Observed phenotypes included delayed development, shortened body axis and @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@pericardiac edema@@@. On the other hand, psychotropic drugs were less @DISEASE_Embryo_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D020964 @@@embryonic lethal@@@ than statins but caused similar phenotypes as well as @DISEASE_Microcephaly @DISEASE_MESH:D008831 @@@microcephaly@@@ and @DISEASE_Holoprosencephaly @DISEASE_MESH:D016142 @@@holoprosencephaly@@@.

citations.NLM: Hartley T, Abdelmagid H, Abdulsalam Z, Mansion A, Howe E, Ramirez D, White K, Tadjuidje E. Embryotoxicity of Statins and other Prescribed Drugs with Reported Off-target Effects on Cholesterol Biosynthesis. Reprod Toxicol. 2024 Dec 10;132():108820. PMID: 39667684

results.title: A Biologically-Based Computational Approach to Drug Repurposing for Anthrax Infection
results.text_hl: On the other hand, the bottom 10 drugs/compounds except @CHEMICAL_Apigenin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D047310 @@@apigenin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Beclomethasone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001507 @@@beclometasone@@@, and @CHEMICAL_enilconazole @CHEMICAL_MESH:C017435 @@@enilconazole@@@ have reported actions similar to those of LT or @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@ET@@@. We ranked @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Bepridil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015764 @@@bepridil@@@ fourth and eighth, which is in agreement with their reported potencies in increasing cell survival.

citations.NLM: Bai JP, Sakellaropoulos T, Alexopoulos LG. A Biologically-Based Computational Approach to Drug Repurposing for Anthrax Infection Toxins (Basel). 2017 Mar 10;9(3):. PMID: 28287432

results.title: The cardioprotection of simvastatin in reperfused swine hearts relates to the inhibition of myocardial edema by modulating aquaporins via the PKA pathway.
results.text_hl: The cardioprotection of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in reperfused @SPECIES_9823 @@@swine@@@ hearts relates to the inhibition of @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@myocardial edema@@@ by modulating aquaporins via the @GENE_PRKACA @GENE_397652 @@@PKA@@@ pathway.

citations.NLM: Li XD, Yang YJ, Geng YJ, Cheng YT, Zhang HT, Zhao JL, Yuan JQ, Gao RL. The cardioprotection of simvastatin in reperfused swine hearts relates to the inhibition of myocardial edema by modulating aquaporins via the PKA pathway. Int J Cardiol. 2013 Sep 10;167(6):2657-66. PMID: 22819122

results.title: The effect of local simvastatin delivery strategies on mandibular bone formation in vivo.
results.text_hl: Results demonstrated that multiple (3) injections of 0.5 mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ effectively reduced soft tissue @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@swelling@@@ while preserving bone growth (60% increase of bone width at 24 days) compared to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ dome placement (43% increase at 24 days).

citations.NLM: Lee Y, Schmid MJ, Marx DB, Beatty MW, Cullen DM, Collins ME, Reinhardt RA. The effect of local simvastatin delivery strategies on mandibular bone formation in vivo. Biomaterials. 2008 Apr;29(12):1940-9. PMID: 18255137

results.title: Influence of simvastatin on hepatocytes - histopathological and immunohistochemical study.
results.text_hl: Apoptosis was visualized by terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase @CHEMICAL_deoxyuridine_triphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C027078 @@@dUTP@@@ nick-end labelling (TUNEL). @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ administration caused acute @<m>DISEASE_Edema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@hepatocyte swelling@@@, @DISEASE_Glycogen_Storage_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D006008 @@@glycogen depletion@@@, hyperaemia, multifocal hepatocyte proliferation with occasional pseudoacinar formation, connective tissue @DISEASE_Hyperplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D006965 @@@hyperplasia@@@, @DISEASE_Hypereosinophilic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D017681 @@@eosinophil@@@ infiltration, and interface @DISEASE_Chemical_and_Drug_Induced_Liver_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D056486 @@@hepatitis@@@.

citations.NLM: Mikiewicz M, Otrocka-Domagała I, Paździor-Czapula K. Influence of simvastatin on hepatocytes - histopathological and immunohistochemical study. Pol J Vet Sci. 2019 Jun;22(2):263-270. PMID: 31269349
